body.p:
Lebanon Ky May 1". 1861
Honl. B. Magoffin
Frankfort
Dear Sir

a few of us have. Sent you the names of Jas. A. Hall for a commission for Justice of the peace for this district in place of Wm. Douglass Esqr Decd the office has been vacant 6 months -- Mr Hall is a qualified good citizen morally & politically
our clerk did not Issue a writ of Election in time for may Election

our political troubles in this county is great Journal & Louisville Democrat has rebounded influence and keeps our people in Ignorance as to the true position of our Distracted Country -- your refusal of Abes Demands gave universal satisfaction for a few days -- the Journal found fault they now Say you are a cesessionist and desire
arms &c for Daviess -- I shall Look for our legislature to appoint a dictator for our state controle arms &C -- friend Benton is now Endeavoring to save the Union at Raywick hope he will succeed those people down there need assistance and if Benten and the Journal fails they can find comfort with the Southern Rights party -- we are few and far -- between but no no such won as fail
